item.title: Twitch is cracking down on sexual harassment in chats
item.description:
Twitch has introduced new policy and moderation updates that aim to help curb sexual harassment. The streaming platform announced in a blog post that it has made its sexual harassment policy “easier to understand” by more clearly outlining prohibited conduct. Twitch’s moderation tools will now also allow streamers to more easily filter out inappropriate chat messages.

Twitch says the policy itself is “largely unchanged,” but now better defines what the Amazon-owned company considers sexual harassment — including “non-physical behaviors of a sexual nature” that would make users feel degraded, uncomfortable, or generally unwelcome on the platform.

“We prohibit unwanted comments — including comments made using emojis/emotes — regarding...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Jess Weatherbed

item.title: Backed by Microsoft, AWS, and Meta, the Overture Maps Foundation launches first open map datasets
item.description:
It’s not often you’ll find Microsoft, Amazon, and Meta in the same room collaborating toward the same goals. But that’s exactly what we have with the Overture Maps Foundation, an initiative to develop interoperable and open map data. Launched in December, 2022, the Overture Maps Foundation is an attempt to counter Google’s stranglehold on online […]

item.title: Vanta trust management platform raises $150M Series C, now valued at $2.45B
item.description:
Vanta, a trust management platform that helps businesses automate much of their security and compliance processes, today announced that it has raised a $150 million Series C funding round led by Sequoia Capital. The company is now valued at $2.45 billion, up from $1.6 billion in 2022 when it raised its $40 million Series B […]

Like Microsoft, Massive AT&T outage also happened because of a bad update
item.description: A nationwide AT&T outage in February was caused by a botched network update, investigation has shown.
